column1: Detecting Incongruity between News Headline and Body Text via a Deep Hierarchical Encoder

column2: Kunwoo Park@Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST)
column4: Hongjun Lim@Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST)
column6: Meeyoung Cha@Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST)

column1: AAAI Technical Track: AI for Social Impact
Some news headlines mislead readers with overrated or false information
column2: and identifying them in advance will better assist readers in choosing proper news stories to consume. This research introduces million-scale pairs of news headline and body text dataset with incongruity label
column3: which can uniquely be utilized for detecting news stories with misleading headlines. On this dataset
column4: we develop two neural networks with hierarchical architectures that model a complex textual representation of news articles and measure the incongruity between the headline and the body text. We also present a data augmentation method that dramatically reduces the text input size a model handles by independently investigating each paragraph of news stories
column5: which further boosts the performance. Our experiments and qualitative evaluations demonstrate that the proposed methods outperform existing approaches and efficiently detect news stories with misleading headlines in the real world.
